Articles.Content: I posted my Imgur album about two weeks ago, was it declined or has he just not seen it yet?

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, Sean24135 said:
> 
> 
> I posted my Imgur album about two weeks ago, was it declined or has he just not seen it yet?
> 

He is on a trip wo Internet access. Said he be back on the 20th.

Your entry looks fine to me.
Thanks
Can I please use kerbal alarm clock?

> 
> 
> On 01/06/2015 at 3:51 PM, sdj64 said:
> 
> 
> Any helpful mod is allowed which doesn't add parts and doesn't change the physics (MechJeb, information mods, **<u>alarm clocks</u>**, enhanced navballs, docking cams, texture replacers, clouds, protractor, fuel balancer, chatterer, etc).
> 

[@littlebuddy0](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/147886-littlebuddy0/) I'd suggest that you reread the rules and mod lists. If you missed this then it's possible you missed something else important.

Any idea of how much Δv for a grandtour with aero-braking?  

Ive got all my landers ready now I just need to make my mothership

I had a devil of a time building a mothership to fit all my various landers, since originally I was going to take three.  I've changed it to two, but now I have to take along a refuelling probe that can refuel the top half of my Tylo lander for use on Pol, Bop, and Vall.  I'm also trying to overestimate fuel use a bit so I make sure I have plenty, but without going overboard.

I have a feeling that the actual mission will be a cakewalk compared to the engineering beforehand.

![:lol:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_laugh.png ":lol:") Having so much fun, though.

[@Barefoot Friar](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/77638-barefoot-friar/) If constructing a suitable mothership is proving difficult, it may benefit you to make just one lander that's capable of SSTO from everywhere but Tylo (challenging but doable) with a custom descent stage for Tylo. About 3000 delta-v should be good for the SSTO part (more if it's not particularly aerodynamic), with probably another thousand or so (and pretty high thrust-to-weight) in the descent stage. Although it's probably best to leave good room for error on that descent stage in any case, considering the immense difficulty of a Tylo landing compared to anywhere else.
Thanks.  I've got a design I'm about to test right now, but if it doesn't work I'll do as you say.
Well whatever you end up doing, good luck with it!

Fun to see that so many are still trying this challenge, I bet this is the oldest still active challenge on the forum, considering that it was first posted in 2013.

I'm looking forward to see what designs you come up with!

[@Mesklin](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/73898-mesklin/) have you goten that sub 11t entry working?

Getting home should take less than 500 m/s dV, when doing a powered tylo assist then going Kerbin->Kerbin->Eve->(2x kebol orbit)->Kerbin.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-05-19T10:24:16Z" title="05/19/2016 10:24  AM" data-short="8 yr">May 19, 2016</time> by Nefrums**

And, finally, my entry in low mass category (deep reworking my one of my entry for version 1.0.5):

1. Start mass: **10.775t**

2. Horizontal takeoff from Kerbin on one RAPIER and vertical landing to Kerbin without any devices - in suit

3. Economical Kerbin-Laythe trajectory: I spent ~1250 m/s dV (Eve-Kerbin-Kerbin flybys). One ion engine for all space maneuvers.

3. Winged  Laythe lander with ion scooter as second stage, same ion scooter for Pol and Bop

4. 2-staged Tylo lander without probe and SAS - only chair, based on 48-7S "Spark" engine. Lander mass: 1.558t with pilot

5. Single staged Laythe lander (2 LV-1R "Spider" engines). Lander mass: 0.524t with pilot

6. Mods used: BetterBurnTime, BetterTimeWarp, HistorianExpanded, IndicatorLights, MechJeb, Kerbal Alarm Clock, KER, Precise Node, Tajectories.

7. Tricks:

a) antenna at the nose of craft works like very good heat shield, with it small detail I could reach 1500+ m/s not so high in atmosphere.

b) fairings are really heavy thing, I tried to make craft's covered part with minimal length and diameter.

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/mOb7W/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

Hi [@Mesklin](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/73898-mesklin/)![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Just... Excellent !

Less than 11T. unbelievable  but true !

Big big congratulations ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

You didnt' flew really safe with Val... but she is alive xD

Well done!

I'll post my entry later tonight. 

I like the trick with the antenna! I opted for just letting the nosecone overheat. And go with the Oscar b in front above 10km.

One tip about the fairing. There is a feature/bug in that the part you close the fairing around does not have its drag affected at all by the fairing. And a part will have its drag increased a lot if it is followed by a smaller part, even if that is bellow the fairing.

If you where to replace the t200 tank with 2x t100 tanks and close the fairing to the one in front it would reduce drag and allow for greater airbreathing speed.

What intake did you use?

For my entry I used only three engines.

By letting the nosecone overheat I was able to reach 1640 m/s in air breathing mode,  This greatly reduced the amount of lf/ox I needed to carry.  Last entry i made had 13 oscar b tanks, this one needed only 6.

I found that the radial ram intake gave better performance then other intakes, they seam to have better drag/intake air ratio then other intakes. I needed 3 of them to avoid the rapier loosing thrust at 15+ km altitude

I made LKO -> Laythe for 1024.5 m/s dV by starting with a muun flyby.

I used a two stage ion lander for val,  That is staged batteries. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D") This allowed me to land on Vall with only one ion engine.

Instead of rtg i used one solar panel. This made the battery recharge time go from hours to days.

My Tylo lander had only 4k m/s dV but this is enough to land at 9km altitude.  The lander will roll over on landing but jeb can flip it.

Take of mass is **8.6** t 

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/YPZMV/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>
[@Nefrums](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/145422-nefrums/) O.... M... G....

Hello everyone and thank you for your patience while I was away.  I will respond to questions now, and will review all of the pending entries soon.  Mesklin and Nefrums, your low mass rivalry has been really entertaining so far, can't wait to see the entries in more detail!  I didn't think it could be done under 10 tons!

> 
> 
> On 5/14/2016 at 11:44 PM, Crazy-Engineer said:
> 
> 
> The most challenging part for me is tat i have this NO Littering extraterrestrial planets thing, so i almost always go for SSTO's  
> 
> I always like a challenging gameplay, dark souls 3 anyone?  
> 
> And as for completing the challenge both ways (ISRU and Non-ISRU) does tat mean u get to keep 2 badges?
> 

Each entry gets its own line in the hall of fame.  There is only one badge for both ways to complete it but I don't care if you put it in your signature twice ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

> 
> 
> On 5/16/2016 at 5:48 PM, Crazy-Engineer said:
> 
> 
> Any idea of how much Δv for a grandtour with aero-braking?  
> 
> Ive got all my landers ready now I just need to make my mothership
> 

My grand tour mothership went to all except Moho, and had 8800 + 1600 for the booster stage for leaving Kerbin.  Using a smaller ship to go to Moho, Dres, Eeloo while your mothership waits at the larger planets will save a lot of dV.  I would say 15000 to be safe if you want to go to all the planets with your whole mothership.  Depending on the max temperature of your heat shield and your skill with gravity assists, it may be less.

This is my 3rd level entry:

Pictures Of Launches: [http://imgur.com/a/p18VY](http://imgur.com/a/p18VY)

Video Of Everything Else:

My mothership was 500 tons.

Kerbal Engineer Redux

Kerbal Joint Reinforcement

Thanks again for your help.
